Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: vela
Description: A Highly Extensible Platform Engine based on Kubernetes and Open Application Model

Arguments.Name: show
Arguments.Description: Show the reference doc for component, trait or workflow types

Arguments.Name: -n
Arguments.Description: Specify the Kubernetes namespace to use

Arguments.Name: env
Arguments.Description: Manage environments for vela applications to run

Arguments.Name: ls
Arguments.Description: List all environments for vela applications to run

Arguments.Name: set
Arguments.Description: Set an environment as the default one for running vela applications

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: Specify the Kubernetes namespace to use

Arguments.Name: --render-only
Arguments.Description: Rendering vela.yaml in current dir and do not deploy

Arguments.Name: --env
Arguments.Description: The environment name for the CLI request

Arguments.Name: --file
Arguments.Description: The file path for appfile or application. It could be a remote url

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: If present, the namespace scope for this CLI request

Arguments.Name: --publish-version
Arguments.Description: The publish version for deploying application

Arguments.Name: --revision
Arguments.Description: The revision to use for deploying the application, if empty, the current application configuration will be used

Arguments.Name: cluster
Arguments.Description: Manage Kubernetes Clusters for Continuous Delivery

Arguments.Name: --kubeconfig-path
Arguments.Description: Specify the kubeconfig path of managed cluster. If you use ocm to manage your cluster, you must set the kubeconfig-path

Arguments.Name: --create-namespace
Arguments.Description: Specifies the namespace need to create in managedCluster (default "vela-system")

Arguments.Name: --name
Arguments.Description: Specify the cluster name. If empty, it will use the cluster name in config file. Default to be empty

Arguments.Name: workflow
Arguments.Description: Operate the Workflow during Application Delivery

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: Specify the Kubernetes namespace to use

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: Specify the Kubernetes namespace to use

Arguments.Name: rollback
Arguments.Description: Rollback an application workflow to the latest revision

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: Specify the Kubernetes namespace to use

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: Specify the Kubernetes namespace to use

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: Specify the Kubernetes namespace to use

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Skip checking if applications are still using this addon

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Specify the addon registry OSS path

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Specify the addon registry OSS path

Arguments.Name: apply
Arguments.Description: Apply UI schema from a file or dir

Arguments.Name: --dry-run
Arguments.Description: Only build definition from CUE into CRB object without applying it to kubernetes clusters

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Specify the definition type of target. Valid types: workflow-step, component, trait, policy, workload, scope

Arguments.Name: doc-gen
Arguments.Description: Generate documentation of definitions (Only Terraform typed definitions are supported)

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Specify the definition type of target. Valid types: workflow-step, component, trait, policy, workload, scope

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Specify the definition type of target. Valid types: workflow-step, component, trait, policy, workload, scope

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Specify the definition type of target. Valid types: workflow-step, component, trait, policy, workload, scope

Arguments.Name: --desc
Arguments.Description: Specify the description of the new definition

Arguments.Name: --interactive
Arguments.Description: Specify whether use interactive process to help generate definitions

Arguments.Name: --git
Arguments.Description: Specify which git repository the configuration(HCL) is stored in. Valid when --provider/-p is set

Arguments.Name: --local
Arguments.Description: Specify the local path of the configuration(HCL) file. Valid when --provider/-p is set

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Specify the output path of the generated definition. If empty, the definition will be printed in the console

Arguments.Name: --path
Arguments.Description: Specify which path the configuration(HCL) is stored in the Git repository. Valid when --git is set

Arguments.Name: --provider
Arguments.Description: Specify which provider the cloud resource definition belongs to. Only alibaba, `aws`, `azure` are supported

Arguments.Name: --template-yaml
Arguments.Description: Specify the template yaml file that definition will use to build the schema. If empty, a default template for the given definition type will be used

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Specify the type of the new definition. Valid types: scope, workflow-step, component, trait, policy, workload

Arguments.Name: --type
Arguments.Description: Specify the definition type of target. Valid types: workflow-step, component, trait, policy, workload, scope

Arguments.Name: --message
Arguments.Description: Specify the header message of the generated YAML file. For example, declaring author information

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Specify the output path of the rendered definition YAML. If empty, the definition will be printed in the console. If input is a directory, the output path is expected to be a directory as well

Arguments.Name: registry
Arguments.Description: Manage Registry of X-Definitions for extension

Arguments.Name: config
Arguments.Description: Configure (add if not exist) a registry, default is local (built-in capabilities)

Arguments.Name: component
Arguments.Description: List component types installed and discover more registry

Arguments.Name: --label
Arguments.Description: A label to filter components, the format is --label type=terraform

Arguments.Name: --token
Arguments.Description: Specify token when using --url to specify registry url

Arguments.Name: --token
Arguments.Description: Specify token when using --url to specify registry url

Arguments.Name: trait
Arguments.Description: List trait types installed and discover more in registry

Arguments.Name: --token
Arguments.Description: Specify token when using --url to specify registry url

Arguments.Name: --token
Arguments.Description: Specify token when using --url to specify registry url

Arguments.Name: uninstall
Arguments.Description: Uninstalls KubeVela from a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Force uninstall whole vela include all addons

Arguments.Name: --detail
Arguments.Description: Show detail log of uninstall information

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: Namespace scope for installing KubeVela Core. (default "vela-system")

Arguments.Name: install
Arguments.Description: Installs KubeVela into a Kubernetes cluster

Arguments.Name: --file
Arguments.Description: Custom the chart path of KubeVela control plane

Arguments.Name: --detail
Arguments.Description: Show detail log of install information

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: Namespace scope for installing KubeVela Core

Arguments.Name: --reuse
Arguments.Description: Will re-use the user's last supplied values. (default true)

Arguments.Name: --version
Arguments.Description: Specify the version of KubeVela to install

Arguments.Name: completion
Arguments.Description: Output shell completion code for the specified shell (bash or zsh). The shell code must be evaluated to provide interactive completion of vela commands

Arguments.Name: export
Arguments.Description: Export deploy manifests from appfile or application

Arguments.Name: --namespace
Arguments.Description: Specify the Kubernetes namespace to use
